headline: How low can credit spreads go? Hologic’s mega LBO tests the limit
summary: Hologic this week wrapped up the broadly syndicated loan portion of a broader financing package supporting its LBO by Blackstone and TPG Capital, cementing its place as one of the largest buyout financings on record and drawing comparisons to another jumbo buyout deal, Medline Industries. Following some sizing adjustments ahead of pricing, financing for the medical technology company comprises term loan B tranches totaling $7.25 billion and €1.3 billion (roughly $1.5 billion equivalent), a $1.25

headline: Hologic wraps massive syndicated LBO loan
summary: Hologic on Jan. 14 priced and allocated the cross-border seven-year term loan backing its Blackstone- and TPG Capital-led buyout, split between a $7.25 billion tranche at S+225 offered at 99.75, and a €1.3 billion piece at E+275 offered at 100. Citi was left-lead arranger on the dollars. BofA Securities and Barclays were left-lead arrangers on the euros. The dollars feature one margin step-down of 25 bps at 5.55x first-lien net leverage, while there are two step-downs of 25 bps each on the euros

headline: Hologic, Inc. (HOLX) Is a Trending Stock: Facts to Know Before Betting on It
summary: Zacks.com users have recently been watching Hologic (HOLX) quite a bit. Thus, it is worth knowing the facts that could determine the stock's prospects.

headline: Hologic Leads Campaign to Emphasize Routine Cervical Cancer Screening
summary: HOLX launches Ultimate Defense, a new U.S. campaign that urges routine Pap + HPV screening to boost awareness and help curb rising underscreening.

headline: 1 Healthcare Stock Worth Investigating and 2 That Underwhelm
summary: Healthcare companies are pushing the status quo by innovating in areas like drug development and digital health. Shareholders who bet on the industry have been rewarded lately as healthcare stocks have returned 21.1% over the past six months, topping the S&P 500 by 10.6 percentage points.
